description: From Hindi पूरी (pūrī), a kind of fried flatbread.

entries.meaning: A type of unleavened bread from India and Pakistan, usually deep-fried.

description: From Balinese ᬧᬸᬭᬷ (puri), from Old Javanese purī (“palace, royal residence”), from Sanskrit पुरी (purī), पुर् (pur, “stronghold, fortress”), from ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *(t)pĺ̥H (“city, fortress, stronghold”). Compare to English polis (“a Greek city-state”).

entries.meaning: In Bali and other parts of Indonesia, a palace, or other residence of a member of the royal family or ruling class.
